comment.body:
I Find that Zeronet is the best option for decentralized websites at the moment, it's a lot more friendly and seems to just work. If you just could use it with an addon or something, would make it easier for people to migrate.
IPFS might be better for transferring big files, but torrents could also be fine.
Wait for Humanity to be extincted
@blurHY: I have not said much about IPFS though, apart from transferring files. So where did you take that conclusion (which is correct, but i don't see the reasoning) from?
@blurHY: I Didn't say it wasn't good for small files. I just meant that i like zeronet better for websites, but using ipfs or torrent for big files would be better than just using zeronet's support.
@blurHY: Oh yeah, i actually had the IPZN page open a second ago.

That's not Chinese culture. Chinese culture was destroyed twice. 
First with the Manchu empire of the Great Qing, then with Mao Zedong's cultural revolution. The famines from Mao's era were medicated with propaganda encouraging people to eat whatever the fuck they would find. It was done before in history, but it was done more in this era.
China, sadly, has taken a great hit to their spiritual side. No wonder so many of them look and sound depressed and optimistic. The CPC is the new god.

I'm against the fact that LBRY requires email. I'm okay with email, but i can't seem to find a single provider that i can trust, works well (doesn't get out of service all the time), has all features (protonmail, for instance, requires you to pay in order to use other clients) and doesn't require stupid stuff like a phone number. I usually only use fake and burner emails. Not only for anonymity/privacy, but because email services are annoying as hell.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: Yes, but it didn't work with external clients last time i checked.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: I'm all ears if you need to talk. Just send me a Zeromail.

@Mg0: Dismail seems good. Didn't ask for a phone number and external clients work. Thanks for the suggestion.

Might be because I dislike anime style stuff, and it would be creepy in classical style.
I don't consider "giving consciousness to animals or animal-like characters" to be furry, though. 
Way older than it, and the thing furries seem to do is roleplaying as them.
I already find roleplaying in RPGs and such to be cringe as fuck, but furry roleplaying for the sake of being the animal (not having the animal part as just a minor characteristic, like if you pretend to be the wolf in a little red cap story) just disgusts me, even with no sex involved.

People here find it funny when US Americans try speaking Portuguese.
The h's seem to be confusing.
Also the R thing, like it's cartoon spanish.

There are some examples [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/aassddff.yo/?Post:22), Like "Brilhou".
It's more like "Breel oow", but I usually see usamericans saying "Breel how".
Or "Maranhão". It's more like "Mara nyawn", but some end up saying "Maran hawn".
Good to know.

Having freedom to do something does not imply that people should do something.
Also, by the very nature of this place, people are free to say they dislike stuff and they shouldn't be published.
After all, I don't see Child Porn in the front page, so I don't think this is a place for Libertinism. 
Should everybody spam because they can spam? Should people think spam is fine because they are free to spam?
Should people not say a thing if somebody would start spamming decapitation and gore scenes in Zerome?
If our moral compass would get off, we'd just be staring at gore, rape scenes, child porn, spam and such here, and this place would be completely worthless.
If free people are unable to regulate themselves, then being free will destroy them, not save them.
Why not?

Living in the name of productivity is enslaving your spirit to the material. 
Boredom is great to have some time for yourself, and nothing else. Good ideas come with it too, usually.

@caryoscelus: But i do mean Boredom. The one that makes people feel so anxious and nervous. Well, it wouldn't usually, but most people can't let themselves get bored anymore, as they are addicted to being stimulated every single second of each day. With some time for yourself, i also mean some time without being stimulated so much by external stuff like computers (mainly mobile ones).
Trust and love have no value if you give it away for free. They are feelings of preference, if you prefer everybody, you don't prefer anybody.
**Unproductive and Unrewarding aggressive comment**

I find that education is one of the most important things in life, and something that helps a lot in achieving happiness.

School systems and compulsory classes, however, are the exact opposite and tend to make you dumber and less happy.

The current widespread education system is based on Bismarck's education system, which was purely an indoctrination method. 

Self-Learning can be liberating, so can learning with others, but classrooms will usually suck your soul out of you.
Which slur?

@Ansho Rei: Both. But the constant stimulation of the mind does affect it a lot. People get more used to virtual stimulation than proper social interaction, and they are already so tired from all that stimulation that real life gets even more tiring. I Know because i feel like that.

I find that one of the biggest issues nowadays is that people expect change to come from the top to the bottom, relying completely on state decisions. Not noticing that there's just a pendulum of status quo that varies between left, center and right, defending the maintenance of what already is.
Rather than expecting politicians and the state to save you, you should do your own acts.
There was one movement here that did not have a political party or vote for a certain politician, but rather did stuff like lecturing the poor, giving milk to mothers who had none, and doing free healthcare and dental treatment.

It is exactly out of the political laziness that the status quo is maintained.
People do not want to make the changes they desire, they want to beg for a politician to do it for them.
There are also many who just wants the aesthetics of it.
The looks of being a left/center/right activists that's all day on some social media making posts about it, or going on organized marches just to show off on the streets, saying words of power with no action.

You can also do "charity through the internet". Many people do need words. Not words of power, that are empty and a show off, but individual words. 
Just listening to people and helping them, spending some time with them, is a good work of charity, many need it.
Sad.
